Jethalal tries to impress Babita by showing off his new 'smart' fridge that talks, but it misunderstands Gujarati phrases and starts arguing loudly, creating chaos in the society hall during the evening meeting.

During a society power outage, Sodhi insists on lighting traditional Punjabi lamps, but the whole colony ends up covered in oil stains, and Bhide blames Jethalal for turning the society into a festival ground without permission.

Daya gets a new robotic vacuum, but it mistakes her loud Gujarati praying rituals for floor dirt and tries to clean her praying area repeatedly, driving her to hilarious frustration while Taarak Mehta tries to explain the technical glitch.

Popatlal, desperate to impress a girl on the phone, asks Tapu Sena to create a romantic setting in the park, but their childish ideas lead to a chaotic surprise party with confused animals, loud music, and Bhide arriving with a complaint letter.

Jethalal buys a bulk order of soap and detergent from Sodhi’s Punjabi shop to save money, but accidentally mixes expensive perfume soap with regular laundry soap. The whole society smells weirdly fragranced, leading to complaints, while Jethalal tries to diplomatically convince everyone it’s a new ‘luxury scent’ trend.

During Ganpati visarjan, Anjali Bhabhi insists on a strict diet before the procession, but after tasting Dr. Hathi’s sweets, she forgets her resolve and starts sneakily eating more. When Bhide finds out, he threatens to banish sweets from society meetings, causing a sugar-fueled rebellion.

Tapu Sena tries to set up a community WiFi using Jethalal’s old router to win neighborhood points, but the signal only works inside Jethalal’s house. Everyone outside gets confused when their phones say ‘Connected’ but can’t load anything, and Popatlal blames this on government conspiracy.

Champak Chacha decides to start a morning yoga group in the society garden, but his strict rules clash with Sodhi’s overly energetic Punjabi dancing warm-ups. The session ends in everyone falling over or bursting into laughter, while Jethalal tries to keep calm and secretly enjoys the chaos.
